Description:
Detects potentially suspicious child process of applications launched from inside the WindowsApps directory. This could be a sign of a rogue ".appx" package installation/execution

Author: Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potentially Suspicious Windows App Activity
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (parent_process_path like '%c:\program files\windowsapps\%' and ((command like '%cmd /c%' or command like '%invoke-%' or command like '%base64%') or (process_path like '%\cmd.exe' or process_path like '%\cscript.exe' or process_path like '%\mshta.exe' or process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe' or process_path like '%\regsvr32.exe' or process_path like '%\rundll32.exe' or process_path like '%\wscript.exe')) and  not (parent_process_path like '%:\program files\windowsapps\microsoft.windowsterminal%' and parent_process_path like '%\windowsterminal.exe' and (process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\cmd.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe')))
